values.description:
This is a first version of VicinityPlugin.

Topic name, distance threshold and update rate can be configured from urdf/sdf.
Some things could be improved like memory management, getting the RobotNamespace from URDF instead of hard coding it, homogenize variables naming etc.. but as the other plugins don't do it so I think we can merge this as is and revisit later along the other plugins if we have time

* remove commented code, add distance detection and id publication

* readding collision actor plugin that disappeared during merge
values.title: RFID

summary.html:
This is a first version of VicinityPlugin.

Topic name, distance threshold and update rate can be configured from urdf/sdf. Some things could be improved like memory management, getting the RobotNamespace from URDF instead of hard coding it, homogenize variables naming etc.. but as the other plugins don't do it so I think we can merge this as is and revisit later along the other plugins if we have time

  • remove commented code, add distance detection and id publication

  • readding collision actor plugin that disappeared during merge

values.description:
The default timeout is too short, and if the simulation takes too long to come up and load the robot's plugin, the spawner gives up and the robot ends up headless.

Thanks for the help, @mikaelarguedas !
values.title: Controller manager wait for robot to come up

summary.raw:
The default timeout is too short, and if the simulation takes too long to come up and load the robot's plugin, the spawner gives up and the robot ends up headless.

Thanks for the help, @mikaelarguedas !

values.description:
Adds the slider functionality form `rqt_ez_publisher` package. 
Changes:
1. The `servicesim_perspective.perspective` has been modified to accommodate the sliders, changed the position of image_view windows in rqt_gui as well. Please feel free to modify the window positions if needed
2. `package.xml` modified to add  `rqt_ez_publisher` as a dependency. 

![Screenshot from 2018-02-21 13-28-37.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/3643089969-Screenshot_from_2018-02-21_13-28-37.png)
values.title: Added slider to the servicesim_perspective

Adds the slider functionality form `rqt_ez_publisher` package. 
Changes:
1. The `servicesim_perspective.perspective` has been modified to accommodate the sliders, changed the position of image_view windows in rqt_gui as well. Please feel free to modify the window positions if needed
2. `package.xml` modified to add  `rqt_ez_publisher` as a dependency. 

![Screenshot from 2018-02-21 13-28-37.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/3643089969-Screenshot_from_2018-02-21_13-28-37.png)

The servicesim_perspective.perspective has been modified to accommodate the sliders, changed the position of image_view windows in rqt_gui as well. values.reason: rqt_ez_publisher not working as desired, needs custom plugin for slider

values.description:
This adds a penalty for when the robot gets too close to a human and/or an object.

There are two cylinders around the robot of different radii, one checks approximations to humans, the other checks approximation to objects:

![radii.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/2553629878-radii.png)

This results in no penalties, because the larger cylinder checks against humans:

![col3.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/1427296655-col3.png)

This results in human approximation penalties:

![col4.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/2549838075-col4.png)

This results in object approximation penalties:

![col5.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/103347638-col5.png)


## Known issue

Right now, when the robot is close to the world origin, it thinks it is colliding with the guest, who is far far away in the private cafe:

![originbug.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/913326091-originbug.png)

I suspect this is a physics bug because the guest has never been animated, I'll leave it as an open issue for now.

## Inflation plugin

All the new plugin does is setting [collide_without_contact](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=collision#contact_collide_without_contact) to true for the "inflation" collisions. I tried a few things to set it directly on URDF but they didn't work.

These collide *with* contact:

~~~
diff -r 478352015077 servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf
--- a/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:09:47 2018 -0800
+++ b/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:20:02 2018 -0800
@@ -28,12 +28,14 @@
       <geometry>
         <cylinder radius="0.75" length="1.07"/>
       </geometry>
+      <collideWithoutContact>true</collideWithoutContact>
     </collision>
     <collision name="inflation_objs">
       <origin rpy="0 0 -0.08" xyz="0 0 0"/>
~~~


~~~
diff -r 478352015077 servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf
--- a/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:09:47 2018 -0800
+++ b/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:27:02 2018 -0800
@@ -28,6 +28,11 @@
       <geometry>
         <cylinder radius="0.75" length="1.07"/>
       </geometry>
+      <surface>
+        <contact>
+          <collide_without_contact>true</collide_without_contact>
+        </contact>
+      </surface>
     </collision>
     <collision name="inflation_objs">
       <origin rpy="0 0 -0.08" xyz="0 0 0"/>
~~~

This crashes the URDF parser:

~~~
diff -r 478352015077 servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf
--- a/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:09:47 2018 -0800
+++ b/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:35:09 2018 -0800
@@ -865,13 +852,21 @@
     </sensor>
   </gazebo>

+  <gazebo reference="base_link">
+    <collision name="inflation">
+      <geometry>
+        <cylinder>
+          <radius>0.5</radius>
+          <length>1.0</length>
+        </cylinder>
+      </geometry>
+      <surface>
+        <contact>
+          <collide_without_contact>true</collide_without_contact>
+        </contact>
+      </surface>
+    </collision>
   </gazebo>
-
   <gazebo reference="base_link">
     <mu1>0.5</mu1>

~~~

with this backtrace:

~~~
#0  0x00007ffff457f6ed in InsertSDFExtensionCollision (_elem=0x7ffec8a2b5a0, _linkName="base_link")
    at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:1904
#1  0x00007ffff459bca0 in CreateCollision (_elem=0x7ffec89d2f40, _link=..., _collision=..., _oldLinkName="base_link_collision")
    at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:3408
#2  0x00007ffff4594b7d in CreateCollisions (_elem=0x7ffec89d2f40, _link=...) at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:3038
#3  0x00007ffff4593d89 in CreateLink (_root=0x7ffec89d56d0, _link=..., _currentTransform=...)
    at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:2908
#4  0x00007ffff459287c in CreateSDF (_root=0x7ffec89d56d0, _link=..., _transform=...)
    at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:2842
#5  0x00007ffff459da2e in sdf::URDF2SDF::InitModelString (this=0x7ffedb7fc24f, 
    _urdfStr="<robot name=\"servicebot\"><!-- Note: this doesnt follow REP 120 as this robot, while having a humanoid shape, will behave like a mobile base --><!-- setting the base_link as the center of mass of the t"..., _enforceLimits=true)
    at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:3523
~~~
values.title: Approximation penalty

summary.raw:
This adds a penalty for when the robot gets too close to a human and/or an object.

There are two cylinders around the robot of different radii, one checks approximations to humans, the other checks approximation to objects:

![radii.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/2553629878-radii.png)

This results in no penalties, because the larger cylinder checks against humans:

![col3.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/1427296655-col3.png)

This results in human approximation penalties:

![col4.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/2549838075-col4.png)

This results in object approximation penalties:

![col5.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/103347638-col5.png)


## Known issue

Right now, when the robot is close to the world origin, it thinks it is colliding with the guest, who is far far away in the private cafe:

![originbug.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/913326091-originbug.png)

I suspect this is a physics bug because the guest has never been animated, I'll leave it as an open issue for now.

## Inflation plugin

All the new plugin does is setting [collide_without_contact](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=collision#contact_collide_without_contact) to true for the "inflation" collisions. I tried a few things to set it directly on URDF but they didn't work.

These collide *with* contact:

~~~
diff -r 478352015077 servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf
--- a/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:09:47 2018 -0800
+++ b/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:20:02 2018 -0800
@@ -28,12 +28,14 @@
       <geometry>
         <cylinder radius="0.75" length="1.07"/>
       </geometry>
+      <collideWithoutContact>true</collideWithoutContact>
     </collision>
     <collision name="inflation_objs">
       <origin rpy="0 0 -0.08" xyz="0 0 0"/>
~~~


~~~
diff -r 478352015077 servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf
--- a/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:09:47 2018 -0800
+++ b/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:27:02 2018 -0800
@@ -28,6 +28,11 @@

         <cylinder radius="0.75" length="1.07"/>
       </geometry>
+      <surface>
+        <contact>
+          <collide_without_contact>true</collide_without_contact>
+        </contact>
+      </surface>
     </collision>
     <collision name="inflation_objs">
       <origin rpy="0 0 -0.08" xyz="0 0 0"/>
~~~

This crashes the URDF parser:

~~~
diff -r 478352015077 servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf
--- a/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:09:47 2018 -0800
+++ b/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf	Wed Feb 21 18:35:09 2018 -0800
@@ -865,13 +852,21 @@
     </sensor>
   </gazebo>

+  <gazebo reference="base_link">
+    <collision name="inflation">
+      <geometry>
+        <cylinder>
+          <radius>0.5</radius>
+          <length>1.0</length>
+        </cylinder>
+      </geometry>
+      <surface>
+        <contact>
+          <collide_without_contact>true</collide_without_contact>
+        </contact>
+      </surface>
+    </collision>
   </gazebo>
-
   <gazebo reference="base_link">
     <mu1>0.5</mu1>

~~~

with this backtrace:

~~~
#0  0x00007ffff457f6ed in InsertSDFExtensionCollision (_elem=0x7ffec8a2b5a0, _linkName="base_link")
    at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:1904
#1  0x00007ffff459bca0 in CreateCollision (_elem=0x7ffec89d2f40, _link=..., _collision=..., _oldLinkName="base_link_collision")
    at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:3408
#2  0x00007ffff4594b7d in CreateCollisions (_elem=0x7ffec89d2f40, _link=...) at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:3038
#3  0x00007ffff4593d89 in CreateLink (_root=0x7ffec89d56d0, _link=..., _currentTransform=...)
    at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:2908
#4  0x00007ffff459287c in CreateSDF (_root=0x7ffec89d56d0, _link=..., _transform=...)
    at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:2842
#5  0x00007ffff459da2e in sdf::URDF2SDF::InitModelString (this=0x7ffedb7fc24f, 
    _urdfStr="<robot name=\"servicebot\"><!-- Note: this doesnt follow REP 120 as this robot, while having a humanoid shape, will behave like a mobile base --><!-- setting the base_link as the center of mass of the t"..., _enforceLimits=true)

summary.html:
This adds a penalty for when the robot gets too close to a human and/or an object.

There are two cylinders around the robot of different radii, one checks approximations to humans, the other checks approximation to objects:

This results in no penalties, because the larger cylinder checks against humans:

This results in human approximation penalties:

This results in object approximation penalties:

Known issue

Right now, when the robot is close to the world origin, it thinks it is colliding with the guest, who is far far away in the private cafe:

I suspect this is a physics bug because the guest has never been animated, I'll leave it as an open issue for now.

Inflation plugin

All the new plugin does is setting collide_without_contact to true for the "inflation" collisions. I tried a few things to set it directly on URDF but they didn't work.

These collide with contact:

diff -r 478352015077 servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf
--- a/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf   Wed Feb 21 18:09:47 2018 -0800
+++ b/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf   Wed Feb 21 18:20:02 2018 -0800
@@ -28,12 +28,14 @@
       <geometry>
         <cylinder radius="0.75" length="1.07"/>
       </geometry>
+      <collideWithoutContact>true</collideWithoutContact>
     </collision>
     <collision name="inflation_objs">
       <origin rpy="0 0 -0.08" xyz="0 0 0"/>

diff -r 478352015077 servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf
--- a/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf   Wed Feb 21 18:09:47 2018 -0800
+++ b/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf   Wed Feb 21 18:27:02 2018 -0800
@@ -28,6 +28,11 @@
       <geometry>
         <cylinder radius="0.75" length="1.07"/>
       </geometry>
+      <surface>
+        <contact>
+          <collide_without_contact>true</collide_without_contact>
+        </contact>
+      </surface>
     </collision>
     <collision name="inflation_objs">
       <origin rpy="0 0 -0.08" xyz="0 0 0"/>

This crashes the URDF parser:

diff -r 478352015077 servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf
--- a/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf   Wed Feb 21 18:09:47 2018 -0800
+++ b/servicebot_description/urdf/servicebot.urdf   Wed Feb 21 18:35:09 2018 -0800
@@ -865,13 +852,21 @@
     </sensor>
   </gazebo>

+  <gazebo reference="base_link">
+    <collision name="inflation">
+      <geometry>
+        <cylinder>
+          <radius>0.5</radius>
+          <length>1.0</length>
+        </cylinder>
+      </geometry>
+      <surface>
+        <contact>
+          <collide_without_contact>true</collide_without_contact>
+        </contact>
+      </surface>
+    </collision>
   </gazebo>
-
   <gazebo reference="base_link">
     <mu1>0.5</mu1>

with this backtrace:

#0  0x00007ffff457f6ed in InsertSDFExtensionCollision (_elem=0x7ffec8a2b5a0, _linkName="base_link")
    at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:1904
#1  0x00007ffff459bca0 in CreateCollision (_elem=0x7ffec89d2f40, _link=..., _collision=..., _oldLinkName="base_link_collision")
    at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:3408
#2  0x00007ffff4594b7d in CreateCollisions (_elem=0x7ffec89d2f40, _link=...) at /media/louise/TERA/code/sdf5/src/parser_urdf.cc:3038
#3  0x00007ffff4593d89 in CreateLink (_root=0x7ffec89d56d0, _link=..., _currentTransform=...)

#5  0x00007ffff459da2e in sdf::URDF2SDF::InitModelString (this=0x7ffedb7fc24f, 
    _urdfStr="<robot name=\"servicebot\"><!-- Note: this doesnt follow REP 120 as this robot, while having a humanoid shape, will behave like a mobile base --><!-- setting the base_link as the center of mass of the t"..., _enforceLimits=true)

values.description:
Added Custom plugins for head pan, tilt and score under servicesim_rqt_plugins as packages:

*   rqt_pan_tilt
* rqt_servicesim_score 

Updated the `servicesim_perspective.perspective` in `servicesim/config` changes should be reflected directly in rqt_gui window

![Screenshot from 2018-02-23 16-05-42.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/1248288310-Screenshot_from_2018-02-23_16-05-42.png)

Added Custom plugins for head pan, tilt and score under servicesim_rqt_plugins as packages:

  • rqt_pan_tilt
  • rqt_servicesim_score

Updated the servicesim_perspective.perspective in servicesim/config changes should be reflected directly in rqt_gui window

values.description:
Also generate a launch file so we can spawn the robot in the correct location.

To review this PR, follow the instructions on [this](#!/osrf/servicesim/wiki/Scenario%20generation) wiki page, making these changes:

1. Change the `wget` to `wget #!/osrf/servicesim/raw/scenario++/servicesim_competition/worlds/scenario.bash`

1. Before running the script, run: `sed -i 's/default/scenario++/g' scenario.bash`
values.title: Scenario++: spawn robot at correct location

summary.raw:
Also generate a launch file so we can spawn the robot in the correct location.

To review this PR, follow the instructions on [this](#!/osrf/servicesim/wiki/Scenario%20generation) wiki page, making these changes:

1. Change the `wget` to `wget #!/osrf/servicesim/raw/scenario++/servicesim_competition/worlds/scenario.bash`

1. Before running the script, run: `sed -i 's/default/scenario++/g' scenario.bash`
summary.html:
Also generate a launch file so we can spawn the robot in the correct location.

To review this PR, follow the instructions on this wiki page, making these changes:

  1. Change the wget to wget #!/osrf/servicesim/raw/scenario++/servicesim_competition/worlds/scenario.bash

  2. Before running the script, run: sed -i 's/default/scenario++/g' scenario.bash

values.description:
Cubicle groups have a single box collision:

![col3.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/4153472082-col3.png)

Closed rooms have a single box collision (mostly to be safe, the door and surrounding walls should be enough):

![col2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/2890094572-col2.png)

Single collision for cafe chairs, port `cafe_table` from model database to this repo, cafe counter box collision:

![col1.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/1979243331-col1.png)

Other cubicle collisions:

![col4.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/3085518148-col4.png)
![col5.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/1700220976-col5.png)
values.title: More simple shape collisions

summary.raw:
Cubicle groups have a single box collision:

![col3.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/4153472082-col3.png)

Closed rooms have a single box collision (mostly to be safe, the door and surrounding walls should be enough):

values.description:
I copied @scpeters's approach from [this SRCSim pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/pull-requests/75/increase-simulation-step-size-to-2ms/diff#chg-src/FinalsPlugin.cc). 

After a lot of testing using the teleop and head controls and bumping into things, this looks quite stable to me, and on my laptop it increases the RTF from 0.2 to 0.4.

I also tried doubling the current values, and while the diff drive seemed to work reasonably, the head controller was shaky.

I also changed the casters' params to match the wheels so the contacts are more stable.
values.title: Performance: double the step size

summary.raw:
I copied @scpeters's approach from [this SRCSim pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/pull-requests/75/increase-simulation-step-size-to-2ms/diff#chg-src/FinalsPlugin.cc). 

After a lot of testing using the teleop and head controls and bumping into things, this looks quite stable to me, and on my laptop it increases the RTF from 0.2 to 0.4.

I also tried doubling the current values, and while the diff drive seemed to work reasonably, the head controller was shaky.

I also changed the casters' params to match the wheels so the contacts are more stable.
summary.html:
I copied @scpeters's approach from this SRCSim pull request.

After a lot of testing using the teleop and head controls and bumping into things, this looks quite stable to me, and on my laptop it increases the RTF from 0.2 to 0.4.

I also tried doubling the current values, and while the diff drive seemed to work reasonably, the head controller was shaky.

I also changed the casters' params to match the wheels so the contacts are more stable.

values.description:
Tweak target areas and spawn points so that there's always enough room for the robot to drop off a guest and then exit. Also place island cubicle chairs tighter close to the desks.

![area2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/1301824641-area2.png)

## Image

* red: each target area
* blue:  target area's minimum point
* green: target area's maximum point
* orange: point within an area where robot or guest is spawned

## Rooms

Room | Area | Point
-- | -- | --
Small meeting room | 3 x 3 m, always without obstacles | Within area, padding = 1.0 m
Large meeting room | 3 x 3 m, always without obstacles | Within area, padding = 1.0 m
Small office | 3 x 3 m, always without obstacles | Within area, padding = 1.0 m
Large office | 3 x 3 m, always without obstacles | Within area, padding = 1.0 m
Refreshment area | 3 x 3 m, always without obstacles | Within area, padding = 1.0 m
Bathroom | 3 x 1.5 m, always without obstacles, outside of room | Within area's center line
Public cubicles (island) | 3 x 3 m, includes the desk and chair | Near area's outer corner
Public cubicles (corners) | 3 x 2 m, always without obstacles | Close to area's outer edge
Front / back / private cafe areas | minimum 2.25 x 2.25 m, always without obstacles | Within area, padding = 1.0 m
Private cubicles | 1.8 x 1.5 m, always without obstacles, outside of cubicle | Within area's center line
values.title: Make room

values.title: Advertise /unadvertise pick-up service as checkpoint starts / ends

summary.html:
@mikaelarguedas , this should prevent the pickup checkpoint from being completed before the "go to pick up" checkpoint.

Also note that pull request #71 makes the guest be spawned further inside the area.

In any case, it is important that the robot completes the checkpoints in order. The room_info service should help by providing the exact bounds within which the robot should be to complete the first one.

values.description:
Add walking actors

![ppl3.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/985872943-ppl3.gif)

* Number of actors configurable from yaml file
* 9 different trajectories, generated using a GUI plugin from the `actor_plugin` branch
* Randomize trajectories and starting points while avoiding overlap
* Actors stop walking if facing robot or other actors
* I tried disabling actor collisions but it didn't have any affect on RTF, so they're enabled. On my desktop I currently get around 0.46
* Some of the trajectories could be more fine tuned, at times their arms enter walls or doors
values.title: Trajectory actors

values.description:
* Removed all the idling actors (bald men) because the value of the animation wasn't worth the performance hit
* Manually chose a few areas in the world where static humans can be spawned, the areas shouldn't overlap target areas or be in the way of trajectories. They can be seen as purple boxes on the debug world:

![idleareas_70.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/1394764057-idleareas_70.png)

* Total number of idling humans configurable in the yaml file
* The script makes sure the humans are at least 1m apart
* They are added as actors, so the RFID senses them and trajectory actors don't bump into them
values.title: Randomly insert static humans in the world

* The script makes sure the humans are at least 1m apart

  • The script makes sure the humans are at least 1m apart
  • They are added as actors, so the RFID senses them and trajectory actors don't bump into them

values.description:
Added test for `servicesim/new_task`,  checks if the response of the service is as desired, i.e:

* pick_up_location: "FrontElevator"

* drop_off_location:"PrivateCubicle_32_1"

* guest_name: "human_86138"

*  and checks if the service call is disabled after the first call. 

run the tests `catkin_make_isolated --catkin-make-args run_tests -j1` , has to be run with flag `-j1` because the gazebo server started in one test interferes with the other tests.
values.title: Added rostest for testing /servicesim/new_task calls

values.description:
The approach from pull request #49 was not working for actors with custom trajectories, so it was reverted on pull request #77.

This new approach is a copy of @iche033's [AttachLightPlugin](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2647/add-plugin-for-attaching-lights-to-links/diff#chg-worlds/attach_lights.world) but just replacing lights with models. Then we create an invisible model with a box collision which is attached to each actor.

![kicktheturtle2_opt.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/228643062-kicktheturtle2_opt.gif)

Worth mentioning I also tried just adding a link with a collision to the actor on  23dd577, but that was not generating contacts. 

In the future, it would be nice to check why the initial approach was failing if more detailed collisions are desired. In this use case, having a single collision is preferred for performance.
values.title: Actor collisions as invisible box models that follow

summary.raw:
The approach from pull request #49 was not working for actors with custom trajectories, so it was reverted on pull request #77.

This new approach is a copy of @iche033's [AttachLightPlugin](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2647/add-plugin-for-attaching-lights-to-links/diff#chg-worlds/attach_lights.world) but just replacing lights with models. Then we create an invisible model with a box collision which is attached to each actor.

![kicktheturtle2_opt.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/gkR8znK/images/228643062-kicktheturtle2_opt.gif)

Worth mentioning I also tried just adding a link with a collision to the actor on  23dd577, but that was not generating contacts. 

In the future, it would be nice to check why the initial approach was failing if more detailed collisions are desired. In this use case, having a single collision is preferred for performance.
summary.html:
The approach from pull request #49 was not working for actors with custom trajectories, so it was reverted on pull request #77.

This new approach is a copy of @iche033's AttachLightPlugin but just replacing lights with models. Then we create an invisible model with a box collision which is attached to each actor.

Worth mentioning I also tried just adding a link with a collision to the actor on 23dd577, but that was not generating contacts.

In the future, it would be nice to check why the initial approach was failing if more detailed collisions are desired. In this use case, having a single collision is preferred for performance.

values.description:
Small tweaks to the scenario generation so it supports a custom robot name.

This ensures the competition logic works with any given name, but we make no guarantees about controllers or the example solution.

Also check this new wiki page:

#!/osrf/servicesim/wiki/Using%20a%20different%20robot
values.title: Support a custom robot name
